## Description
The **Generate Purl **task returns a personalized URL (Purl) for a document in a Digital Archiving store.

> Note

A Purl can only be generated for one single document at a time.

Purls generated with this task will always be signed.

## Configuration
**![](data:image/png;base64,)**

- In the **Alias **field, enter the name of the task that will be displayed in the workflow.

- In the **Resource **field, select the Digital Archiving store resource to use.

> Note

For more information, see [Digital Archiving Store Resource Reference](/doxee-platform/docs/digital-archiving-store-resource-reference).

- In the **Document identifier attribute **field, enter the path to the document identifier attribute.

> **Supported path notations**

The Document identifier attribute can be expressed in one of the following ways:

**/Root/Node/Subnode**: Full XPath expression starting from the root

- **/Root/Node[@attribute]**: Path with predicate to find an attribute in a node

- **/Root/Node[@attribute='value']**: Path with predicate to find an attribute with a matching value in a node. The value must be expressed as a string.

- **/Root/Node/***: Wildcard search to register all children of the given node

- In the **Generated Purl attribute **field, select the path where the generated Purl should be enriched.

> **Supported path notations**

The Purl identifier attribute can be expressed in one of the following ways:

**/Root/Node/Subnode**: Full XPath expression starting from the root

- **/Root/Node[@attribute]**: Path with predicate to find an attribute in a node

- **/Root/Node[@attribute='value']**: Path with predicate to find an attribute with a matching value in a node. The value must be expressed as a string.

- **/Root/Node/***: Wildcard search to register all children of the given node

- In the **Duration (seconds) **field, enter a time-to-live for the generated Purl.

- In the **Custom domain **field, enter a custom domain to use for the generated Purl.

## Input
The input of the task is an XML containing a unique document identifier and a path to insert the generated Purl. The path to the identifier must be specified in the **Document identifier attribute **field. The path for the generated Purl must be specified in the **Purl identifier attribute **field.

Depending on the placement of the Generate Purl task relative to the [Archive Documents (DA)](/doxee-platform/docs/archive-documents-da-batch-workflow-task-reference) task in the same workflow, these fields may be configured one of two ways:

### Archive documents (DA) before Generate Purl
If the Archive documents (DA) task is placed before the Generate Purl task in the same workflow branch, the **Document identifier attribute **and **Pur l identifier attribute **fields may be configured using the standard output of the Archive documents (DA) task.

![](data:image/png;base64,)

The output of the Archive documents (DA) task is a *LOADER.DA.INDEX.xml* file containing a unique document identifier (see [Digital Archiving 3 Loader Index File](/doxee-platform/docs/digital-archiving-3-loader-index-file)). The path to this identifier may be used in the **Document identifier attribute** field.

> Tip

The automatically generated document identifier on the Digital Archiving system may also be configured as a system index *Purl identifier*

in the Digital Archiving Stores configuration. For further information, see [Digital Archiving Stores - Managing Indexes](/doxee-platform/docs/digital-archive-developer-guide-manage-indexes).

The *LOADER.DA.INDEX.xml *file also contains an attribute to enrich a generated Purl. This attribute may be used in the **Generated Purl attribute **field.

> Note

For more information on the structure of the *LOADER.DA.INDEX.xml *file, see [Digital Archiving 3 Loader Index File](/doxee-platform/docs/digital-archiving-3-loader-index-file).

### Archive documents (DA) after Generate Purl
If the Generate Purl task is placed before the Archive documents (DA) task in the same workflow branch, the **Document identifier attribute **must be configured using a generated GUID. This GUID may be provided by the [Transform files (DT)](/doxee-platform/docs/transform-files-dt-batch-workflow-task-reference) task and subsequently used by the [Compose documents (DC)](/doxee-platform/docs/compose-documents-dc-batch-workflow-task-reference) task to create the document and prepare it for archiving, for example:

![](data:image/png;base64,)

- The Transform files (DT) task builds an output XML and generates a GUID as a unique document identifier.

- The Generate Purl task consumes the output of the previous task. It reads the generated GUID and enriches the output XML with a Purl in the specified path.

- The Compose documents (DC) task consumes the output of the previous task. It creates the document and the *LOADER.DA.INDEX.xml *file which may be used to upload the document to a Digital Archiving Store.

> Important

The *LOADER.DA.INDEX.xml *file created by the Compose documents (DC) task must contain a tag with an attribute **&lt;purl @docGuid&gt;**. The GUID value must match the GUID read by the Generate Purl task preceding it.

- The Archive documents (DA) task consumes the output of the Compose documents (DC) task and provides as output the input XML file.

## Output
The output of the task is the input XML enriched with the Purl in the attribute specified in the **Generated Purl attribute **field.
